attributes.action: SCRAP OR REDUCE B&B ALCHOHOL LICENCES
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under the licensing act B&Bs have been lumped with Pubs & Clubs that are selling alchohol as the primary scource of their profit and thereby creating social disorder whereas B&Bs offer refreshment to their "Bona Fide" guests ONLY and not the general public and therefore do not create social disorder.

The previous Justices Licence cost B&Bs £30 for three years, but now costs £180 per year under the new act.(Plus the cost of the changeover)

This is an unfair "Stealth" back door Tax and most B&Bs do not make that much profit on their YEARLY Bar sales.

As a consiquence many B&Bs are giving up their licence reducing their guest facillities
